title: American Printing House
subtitle: Accessibility for all
shortDesc: …or at least as close as you can get. We learned A LOT about accessibility while working on this site. Besides needing to meet strict a11y standards, this is also an e-commerce and membership site. A beautiful beast of a project.
stack: HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript, PHP, Wordpress, React
categories: Ad Agency, Professional, Wordpress, CMS, Backend, Frontend

title: Frost Brown Todd
subtitle: So many things
shortDesc: An incredibly flexible and intuitive search experience, complex and beautiful data relationships and taxonomies, a custom-built WP Walker Nav, nested modals, and a user-friendly back-end editing experience make this site one of my favorite builds.
categories: Ad Agency, Professional, Wordpress, CMS, Backend, Frontend

title: The Parklands
subtitle: Incredibly beautiful and incredibly complex
shortDesc: This site was challenging (fun) from an information architecture standpoint. The various locations are categorized through relational taxonomies, and all searchable from an interactive map. \n I’m also proud of a complicated Alert system that allows the client to create site-wide, park-specific, and location-specific alerts with expiration dates. The alerts use dynamically produced cookies to disappear after being read.
stack: HTML5, JavaScript, SCSS, PHP, Wordpress, React
categories: Ad Agency, Professional, Wordpress, CMS, Backend, Frontend

title: One Southern Indiana
subtitle: APIs and Ads
shortDesc: 1si was an incredibly fun site to build. Some highlights included building a custom plugin to connect to a third part API to pull in events, as well as a utilizing a common Ad Plugin (with some custom tweaks) to integrate ads into various parts of the site dynamically.
stack: HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript, PHP, Wordpress, React
categories: Ad Agency, Professional, Wordpress, CMS, Backend, Frontend

title: New Directions
subtitle: Beautiful and understated
shortDesc: New Directions is a site I’m proud to be a part of. It was also built using Gutenberg and React and provides the client with an incredible editing experience.
categories: Ad Agency, Professional, Wordpress, CMS, Backend, Frontend

title: Windows 95
subtitle: Because why not?
shortDesc: Shoutout to the vintage OS. Just a fun little project.

title: JS Array Functions
subtitle: More fun than it sounds
shortDesc: I wanted to memorize all of the JS array methods so I built this site. Update: I have not memorized all of the JS array methods....but the site was super fun to build.

title: booklist
subtitle: Pure obsession
shortDesc: I wanted to learn more about React, so I made a site that functions like React...but with vanilla JS. \n Also, I'm suuuuuuuuper into the "romantasy" genre so making a website for that seemed like a good call. \n IYKYK.

title: Template Reference
subtitle: Automated ease
shortDesc: This site is a reference for all of the different possible sections in a templating system I built. It pulls directly from the templating system, so whenever a new section is added to the system, it is automatically added (and organized) to the template reference \n I made this to help the design and sales teams have an easier time creating designs for our partner landing pages.

title: Templating System
subtitle: Robust and flexible
shortDesc: We needed a way to create hundreds of landing pages quickly with a wide variety of features and text, and this was the solution. \n This system uses a single config file and some child sections to create fully customizable landing pages, and has made hundreds of them to date.
